physical_appearance:This is a photograph of the gateway to the Jumma mosque in Lahore. The photograph features a central tower-like archway entrance with a tall half-dome
 and two smaller domed archways on either side. There is a man standing in the middle of the archway. On the left of the photo
 there is another man standing in the courtyard. The title is written at the bottom
 below the photograph.

metadata.title_text: Photograph album of views and portraits in the Punjab, Cashmere, Ceylon, Burma, Penang, Singapore, and Java Gateway of Jumma Musjid, Lahore
metadata.materials_name: albumen (egg white protein) albumen paper paper (fiber product)
metadata.physical_appearance: This is a photograph of the gateway to the Jumma mosque in Lahore. The photograph features a central tower-like archway entrance with a tall half-dome, and two smaller domed archways on either side. There is a man standing in the middle of the archway. On the left of the photo, there is another man standing in the courtyard. The title is written at the bottom, below the photograph.
metadata.subject_terms_2: Photographs Thomson, J. (John), 1837-1921 Lahore (Pakistan) Mosques Gateways Architecture, Mogul Empire
